description:
Cyclovirus PK5006 is a viral species that belongs to the family Cycloviridae. It is a small, non-enveloped virus with a circular, single-stranded DNA genome. The genome of Cyclovirus PK5006 is approximately 2 kilobases in size and encodes two major open reading frames, which are responsible for the production of the viral replication-associated protein and the viral capsid protein.

Cyclovirus PK5006 was initially discovered in a fecal sample collected from a pig in Pakistan. It is classified as a member of the genus Cyclovirus, which includes a diverse group of viruses that have been detected in various vertebrate and invertebrate hosts, including humans, animals, and insects.

The biological and ecological characteristics of Cyclovirus PK5006 are not yet fully understood, as it is a recently discovered virus. Further research is needed to elucidate its host range, transmission dynamics, and potential impact on the health of its host organisms.
